paragraph.heading:
Coelogyne punctulata Lindl., Coll. Bot .
: t. 33, 1824

subSubSection.paragraph:

,

Distribution:â€” The Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar and southwestern China .

Note:â€” Keenan et al. 3208 is a small-flowered form of this species that also occurs in China , which has been confused with
C. nitida (Wall. ex D.Don) Lindl.

Distribution:â€” The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Vietnam and southwestern China .

Coelogyne sanderae Kraenzl.
,
Reichenbachia
, ser. 2, 2: t. 56, 1893. Type :â€” MYANMAR . Upper part: imp.
Sander s.n.
( lectotype K, designated by Seidenfaden 1992: 117)

Heterotypic synonym:
Coelogyne sanderae Oâ€™Brien, Gard. Chron .
, ser. 3, 13: 360, 1893, in fig. 52 on p. 361 as
C. sanderiana
[non Rchb. f. 1887].
Type :â€” Not designated
.

Specimens examined:â€” UPPER MYANMAR . Type ; same loc., cult. Birmingham Bot. Gard. s.n. (K). KACHIN . Putao District: fide
Aung et al. (2020: 72)
. CHIN . Mindat District: Swinhoe 32 (K). SHAN . Taunggyi District: fide Nyan Tun (2014: 133 ; as
Coelogyne sp.
). BORDER AREA KAYAH â€“ KAYIN (Bawlake â€“ Hpa-An). 1920 m , Oct 1939 , Dickason 9469 (AMES). WITHOUT LOCALITY. Cult. Glasnevin Bot. Gard. s.n. (K). Reported from Sagaing , Magway and Mandalay regions by
Kress et al. (2003: 70)
, but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:â€” Myanmar , Vietnam and southwestern China .

Note:â€” It is not really certain if Oâ€™Brien intended to describe
C. sanderae
; the following week in the Gardenersâ€™ Chronicle (ser. 3, 13: 391) it was explained that the relevant part of
Reichenbachia
had not reached the editor of Gardenersâ€™ Chronicle in time, and the name could therefore not be credited to Kraenzlin.

Coelogyne schilleriana Rchb.
f., Berliner Allg. Gartenzeitung 26: 189, 1858. Type :â€” MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , 1857, cult.
Schiller s.n.
( holotype : W)

Heterotypic synonym:

4: 137, 1864.

ex

( K )
;

Calcutta Bot. Gard. s.n.
( GH )
.
Distribution:â€” Myanmar and Thailand .

Note:â€” In the description of
P. schilleriana
(attributed to J.Dix, the chair of the meeting where it was presented), a basionym is not given, and it is therefore considered a new species, not a transfer.
